spanGrp.span: NHK describes different rituals and spiritual practices in the Tabaq community.
Panasonic Lumix DMC-GH2K (set to AVCHD(1080i), FSH), plus external stereo microphone (Rode Stereo VideoMic) & windshield
Zoom H4n (set to WAV, 44.1Hz/16bit) + Beyerdynamic M 58 microfone
D13NHKRituals.mts (= original video) D13NHKRituals_Zoom.wav (= separate audio recording, time code doesn't match time code of video) D13NHKRituals.txt (= this Toolbox file)
ok nsereldin is going to tell us about the Tabaq spiritual life and the different rutuals ok nasreldin
ok nsereldin is going to tell us about the Tabaq spiritual life and the different rutuals ok nasreldin
Iwear by allah ,I do not have much information about kujuurs very well

walai = Ar. I swear by Alla; k plural kr= is the an ordinary person but sometimes he gets possessed by an spirit. this spirit which possesse the k is called /r/ plural/r/. so, the r is said to tell the poeple what to do and wahtt not to do through the mediation of k. each paternal clan in Tabaq has r/ and so many kr . the r usually possesses one k at a time e.i. he never possesses two kr at the same time(only after the death of the possessed then he changes to another k. ; k is called kujuur

gurar = Ar. dreived from the verb (giraa'a) which means reading, but here in this context it means school. ; here he wants to say that I do not know so much information about the spiritual life and the practices of the kujuurs who lead the spiritual side of the Tabaq community because I left Tabaq area for my schooling since I was so young and I come only during the holidays.
means in Tabaq only few who go (to school)
krmb kkn ymnd laakin w ytaa taan kaan wr
I do not have much information about Kujuur , but what I know ; Tabaq poeple in the past
laakin = Ar. (but) kaan = Ar. (in the past)
they were keeping many kujurs ( it means that they were so muchconcerned and attached to the kujuurs becuase they thought that they are the sourc of everything)
they practice the rituals of the kujuurs and each paternal clan
byan r kalm dtn r kalm kbal r kalm
biyani had a kujur dutuni had a kujur and komblai had kujur
Biyani, Dutuni, and Kombali are paternal clans in Tabaq
aaa shotuni also had a kujuur
aa isim [kun] kniya t r kal
aa and each paternal clan having a kujur
kaman tk yaani tk haarka kal
and they practice the kujur rituals and they have a lot of such practices
kamaan = Sudanese Arabic means (also) haarka = Sudanese Arabic which means (very)
tkm taiyb t r r d ktngdr
they had such practices, well when the spirit possesses a person
a person connot be possessed willingly
it is the spirit who come and possess the person
means it comes to the person and make him ill and make him fell down unwillingly
ta ta haarka tawt rya ynd
the spirit comes and cuase him to do abnormal things then poeple would realize that it the spirits act
aa r wattya y ti fndita a rnd kna ft
and the elder poeple would recognize that and tell the person that you are possessed by the spirit
aa r filaand kn fit xalas tyaa sabrn tknd
aa they tell that it is the spirit (and they tell him the name of the spirit) who is possessing you, then they make a cermony for him and do some rituals for him
then they make him a kujur, well the kujuurs
in the past if Tabaq poeple wanted rain they would go to the kujuurs house (to ask for it)
there is a special kujjur for rain
aaa t (a name of a clan)
d waya waya tii agmnya findga t dr rn zaatl
if a person does not want his cows to be cought by disease he would go to this caln poeple themselves
waya nmniya ftnga wal d waya kndnga knaal d utu
if a person does not want to be ill or he was ill he would go to the kujurs house (to have his blessings)
kndga wala tndga tya waya waggnd
the the kujur would take away that illness if it is cuased by bad spirits or a normal illness
he would take all the things away from him
then the ill person's body would recover
d xatrnga t br waaantga kald
if a person wanted to travel or to go to any other place he would go to the kujuur first
t bt t diir n ana tatnga
if a person was far away, he travelled and stayed there for a long time and came back
r wat taa t ldndt d kamaan kaa ka
the elders would come and drink the water before him then he drinks after them and also they take him to the kujurs house (to take the returning back bleassings)

in Tabaq community the elders are very respected becuase they are bleived to be the source of blessings . that is why they have to be consulted in any thing . so, if someone wants to travel he has to take their permission and blessing , and when someone coming from a long journey he has to go to the elders first and to drink after them (water, milk, rum) before he goes to his own compound.
taa d ald aknay ii itufi r wat tf
come and put your things inside and go , the elder would tell him like that
aa taani kaan wr wttka tukei
aa Tabaq poeple in the past have many rituals
they have also known the religion (islam)
dn = Ar. religion referining to the Islamic Religion the only other formal religion in the Tabaq community , becides the local beliefs
yaani kaan salm kamaan aramdaa km
they do their prayers and fast the month of Ramadan
yaani = Ar. means e.i. ; kaan = Ar. means was ; salm = Ar. Sala ; armdaan = Ar. Ramadan ( the month of Ramadan , the fasting month for muslems)
t yka kaman t rya t a
they knew it and they also did the kujurs rituals
it means that they kept the old traditions along with the teachings of Islam which came recently to them . putting in mind that Islam has forbidden most of the traditions and the ritual practices .
kr kr kr and kamaan dnmbya yaan andm
they were keeping the kujurs traditions and rituals and also the new religion(Islam) teachings
kamaan yaan tr ky kaan wbrm taar
also there were so many spirits and kujuurs in Tabaq
the new harvest , in the harvesting time
aa t r watt ldmndga yna adl wa da
if a new thing was not tested by the elders we would never eat it , we even affraid to eat it
all these are the traditions of our plder poeple
kulo tagald ind ahalna algudaam = the whole sentence is in arabic
hhh l kr xaffo xaffo kr laakn xaffo
now kujuurs are few , there are some but very few
they are not so many as it used to be in the past
bbr bbr maa r zaatn slaamr wttka tak l
and only few of them , because now so many poeple have embraced Islam as their only religion
waa fi yx bk yxa mj taani
and there are some sheikhs , some of the Tabaq poeple become Islamc sheikhs
waa =Ar. means and sheikh =Ar. Islamic religion teacher
they do not like talking about the spirits or kujuurs
bbr bbr kaan r wat ma r wat bizkoroom t knr
onlly the elders are used to talk about the work of the kujurs
